channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Thursday's analyst calls: CVS gets upgraded, JPMorgan lowers rating on industrial giant
item.description: A pharmacy operator and an industrial stock were among the stocks being talked by analysts on Thursday.

item.title: Chip stocks look relatively weak as S&P 500 books record high
Billionaire Mark Cuban once ran a Ponzi scheme to pay for his college tuition
item.description: Before Cuban was worth nearly $8 billion, he ran a scam from his dorm room.

item.title: Ripple launches crypto storage services for banks in bid to diversify
item.description: Ripple said it is launching a slew of features aimed at helping banks and fintechs store digital tokens — as part of a broader push into crypto custod...

item.title: Tributes pour in for Ratan Tata from industry titans and politicians
item.description: Ratan Tata passed away on Wednesday, aged 86.

item.title: Near-miss at Nashville airport after two planes were cleared to use the same runway
item.description: Pilots of the Alaska plane aborted their Sept. 12 takeoff at Nashville International Airport, applying the brakes so hard that the tires deflated.

item.title: 7-Eleven's parent company cuts full-year earnings forecast, presses ahead with restructuring
item.description: The news comes as the Japanese retail group resists a takeover attempt by Canada's Alimentation Couche-Tard.

item.title: Banksy stab-proof vest made famous by British rapper Stormzy sold for £780,000
item.description: "In a way only Banksy can, he manages to powerfully condense a complex social issue through one redolent object."

item.title: British pharma giant GSK strikes $2.3 billion deal to put an end to 80,000 U.S. lawsuits
item.description: GSK has agreed to pay $2.3 billion to put an end to lawsuits alleging that its Zantac heartburn drug caused cancer.

item.title: GSK settles vast majority of Zantac claims for $2.2 billion
